snippet.textDisplay:
Mega Mon!
Cut Man -> Metal Man
Junk Man -> Concrete Man -> Stone Man
Hard Man -> Guts Man
Bomb Man -> Grenade Man -> Napalm Man
Burst Man -> Commando Man
Fire Man -> Heat Man -> Flame Man
Elec Man -> Quick Man or Plug Man, depending on whether Thunder Stone or Metal Coat is being held upon leveling up
snippet.textOriginal:
Mega Mon!
Cut Man -> Metal Man
Junk Man -> Concrete Man -> Stone Man
Hard Man -> Guts Man
Bomb Man -> Grenade Man -> Napalm Man
Burst Man -> Commando Man
Fire Man -> Heat Man -> Flame Man
Elec Man -> Quick Man or Plug Man, depending on whether Thunder Stone or Metal Coat is being held upon leveling up

snippet.textDisplay:
Mega Man 7 I'd argue to be one of best MMs, tied for the 3rd best for me, right there with MM9. MM2 & 3 are pretty tough to top for the others.
As for Capcom: Y U CANCEL MEGA MAN UNIVERSE AND MEGA MAN LEGENDS 3????
And then that UMVSC3 Zero costume...Capcom is trolling every Mega Man fan out there.
And sadly with Infaune gone, they have even suggested and rumored the Blue Bomber's death. I don't believe it though, it's unlikely and even if it were, I wouldn't want to. Mega Man was my first game.
snippet.textOriginal:
Mega Man 7 I'd argue to be one of best MMs, tied for the 3rd best for me, right there with MM9. MM2 & 3 are pretty tough to top for the others.
As for Capcom: Y U CANCEL MEGA MAN UNIVERSE AND MEGA MAN LEGENDS 3????
And then that UMVSC3 Zero costume...Capcom is trolling every Mega Man fan out there.
And sadly with Infaune gone, they have even suggested and rumored the Blue Bomber's death. I don't believe it though, it's unlikely and even if it were, I wouldn't want to. Mega Man was my first game.

snippet.textDisplay: @confuzzled93 Megaman 3, Megaman V for the Gameboy, Legends, X, all top quality Megaman games. I wonder how they "sucked". Yes, I realize there's a difference of opinions and that yours should be respected, but I honestly don't see how MM "sucked" after the second.
snippet.textOriginal: @confuzzled93 Megaman 3, Megaman V for the Gameboy, Legends, X, all top quality Megaman games. I wonder how they "sucked". Yes, I realize there's a difference of opinions and that yours should be respected, but I honestly don't see how MM "sucked" after the second.

snippet.textDisplay: Stats watch: Now at its second song on this list, Mega Man 7 is tied with fellow Mega Man entries 10, 4, and 6.  Sadly, if you add together all at of their cumulative songs, they still are one behind Secret of Mana (clocking in at nine).
snippet.textOriginal: Stats watch: Now at its second song on this list, Mega Man 7 is tied with fellow Mega Man entries 10, 4, and 6.  Sadly, if you add together all at of their cumulative songs, they still are one behind Secret of Mana (clocking in at nine).

snippet.textDisplay: On the NES, you could always tell when it's a game by Capcom just by listening to the music, and it was the same thing on the SNES. This is a game I only played much later after its release but I really like it, like most of the MM games. It's really too bad they cancelled Mega Man Legends 3.
snippet.textOriginal: On the NES, you could always tell when it's a game by Capcom just by listening to the music, and it was the same thing on the SNES. This is a game I only played much later after its release but I really like it, like most of the MM games. It's really too bad they cancelled Mega Man Legends 3.
